name: How to use the sandbox - Linking nodes
description: This tutorial will demonstrate how to link nodes in the sandbox to create kinematics systems.

pages.textBefore: The links are inside the node drawer. They are added in the same way as nodes. However, when using add-on-click mode, if the click is over a node, the link connects to it and sets the end point on the second click. This way it is possible to quickly connect two nodes by using add-on-click and clicking on the nodes.
pages.textAfter: This image shows the link option in the node drawer.

pages.textBefore: Since a link connects two points, to move them click and drag the edge of the link closest to the end point. If the end point is near a node, it snaps and connects to it. To disconnect a link, click and drag that edge away from the node.
pages.textAfter: In this image, the lower point of the link is being dragged and is connecting to the clamped translating node. The number on the link is its length.
